goals.question: What is the distribution of the budget amounts across different categories?
goals.visualization: Bar chart of budget amount vs category
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand which categories have the highest and lowest budgets and how they compare to each other.

goals.question: What is the trend of budget allocation over the years?
goals.visualization: Line chart of budget amount vs year
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand how the budget allocation has changed over the years and if there are any patterns or trends.

goals.question: What is the proportion of budget allocated to salaries and wages?
goals.visualization: Stacked bar chart of budget amount vs category and salary/wages
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the proportion of budget allocated to salaries and wages compared to other categories.

goals.question: What is the distribution of budget amounts across different departments?
goals.visualization: Bar chart of budget amount vs department
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand which departments have the highest and lowest budgets and how they compare to each other.

goals.question: What is the trend of budget allocation for each department over the years?
goals.visualization: Line chart of budget amount vs year for each department
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand how the budget allocation has changed over the years for each department and if there are any patterns or trends.

code:
import seaborn as sns
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker
import pandas as pd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    ax = sns.barplot(x='category', y='budget_amount', data=data)
    plt.title('What is the distribution of the budget amounts across different categories?', wrap=True)
    plt.xticks(rotation=45)
    if len(plt.xticks()[0]) > 20:
        ax.xaxis.set_major_locator(ticker.MaxNLocator(20))
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
chart.show()

import pandas as pd
import seaborn as sns
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    
    data['year'] = pd.to_datetime(data['year'], format='%Y', errors='ignore')
    sns.lineplot(x='year', y='budget_amount', data=data)
    
    if len(plt.xticks()[0]) > 20:
        plt.gca().xaxis.set_major_locator(ticker.MaxNLocator(20))
    
    plt.xticks(rotation=45)
    plt.title('What is the trend of budget allocation over the years?', wrap=True)
    
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
chart.show()

import pandas as pd
import seaborn as sns
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    ax = sns.barplot(x='category', y='budget_amount', hue='salary/wages', data=data)
    plt.title('What is the proportion of budget allocated to salaries and wages?', wrap=True)
    plt.xticks(rotation=45)
    if len(plt.xticks()[0]) > 20:
        ax.xaxis.set_major_locator(ticker.MaxNLocator(20))
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
chart.show()

import seaborn as sns
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker
import pandas as pd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    ax = sns.barplot(x='department', y='budget_amount', data=data)
    plt.title('What is the distribution of budget amounts across different departments?', wrap=True)
    plt.xticks(rotation=45)
    if len(plt.xticks()[0]) > 20:
        ax.xaxis.set_major_locator(ticker.MaxNLocator(20))
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
chart.show()

import pandas as pd
import seaborn as sns
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    data['date'] = pd.to_datetime(data['date'], errors='ignore')
    sns.lineplot(x='date', y='budget_amount', hue='department', data=data)
    plt.title('What is the trend of budget allocation for each department over the years?', wrap=True)
    plt.xticks(rotation=45)
    if len(plt.xticks()[0]) > 20:
        plt.gca().xaxis.set_major_locator(ticker.MaxNLocator(20))
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
chart.show()

    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    data['date'] = pd.to_datetime(data['date'], errors='ignore')

    plt.xticks(rotation=45)
    if len(plt.xticks()[0]) > 20:
        plt.gca().xaxis.set_major_locator(ticker.MaxNLocator(20))
    return plt;
